title: Troilus
summary: Troilus[1] (English:  /ˈtrɔɪləs/ or /ˈtroʊələs/; Ancient Greek: Τρωΐλος, romanized: Troïlos; Latin: Troilus) is a legendary character associated with the story of the Trojan War. The first surviving reference to him is in Homer's Iliad, which some scholars theorize was composed by "bards" (aoidoi) and sung in the late 9th or 8th century BC.[2]
